Body:
Let's say I have a command line app that has the following functions:

function createABox() { console.log("hey"); };
function deleteABox() { console.log("wutsup"); };

The command line app can take any kind of text input. I want the app to call createABox whenever it makes sense to do so from an English speaking perspective. For example:

"create a box", "create box", "new box", "I want a new box", "new container"

should all call createABox. Is this a common linguistics problem and if so what would be the pseudocode algorithm for something like that? Thanks.
Title: Algorithm for converting an English sentence or phrase into a function call

LastEditedUser.AboutMe:
Travelling armchair linguist.

Never studied in an institution but read books and web with probably more breadth than depth.

Always on the road surviving in a strange foreign language, currently Mongolian and Mandarin Chinese.

And I collect dictionaries.

OwnerUser.AboutMe:
Graduated from Neumann University in Computer Information and Systems Management in 2007.

I've been in web development since 2008, working for small startups to big tech firms.
